New Records: Haris Rauf got to the 100-wicket mark in just 69 innings, the third-fastest in T20I history
Aaron Johnson scored a 44-ball 52, the most runs by a Canada batter in a T20I
Key Match Events: Aaron Johnson scored a 52 off 44 balls, the highest score by a Canada batter in a T20I
Fakhar Zaman was dismissed for 4, ending Pakistan's chase with 15 balls remaining
Babar Azam fell with victory in sight, leaving Pakistan needing 24 runs off 32 balls
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan made one change, bringing in Saim Ayub and dropping Iftikhar Ahmed
Canada made one change, with Dilpreet Bajwa being replaced by Ravinderpal Singh
Post-Match Reflections: Pakistan finally registered a win in their third Group A game
The victory was a pivotal moment in Pakistan's playoff push
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played on a fresh surface, the fourth drop-in pitch at the Nassau County
This was the 22nd match of Group A, New York, June 11, 2024, ICC Men's T20 World Cup
Others: The match was won by Pakistan by 7 wickets
Canada managed to score 106 for 7 in their innings
